title: gradecast
text: package allows someone estimate grade range can expect achieve program based current grade number ECTS completed. grade range calculated based best worst possible outcomes remaining ECTS. basic assumption package grading follows standard German university grading system, 1 best grade 5 worst. user, however, can specify best worst possible grades program, package calculate grade range based values.

title: gradecast
text: calculate best worst possible grade outcomes based current grade number ECTS credits already completed, calculate_grade_range() function used. function takes following arguments: completed_ects: number ECTS credits already completed current_grade: current grade average remaining_ects: number ECTS credits remaining complete max_passing_grade: best possible grade min_passing_grade: worst possible grade function returns named numeric vector two elements: best_outcome worst_outcome. values represent best worst possible grade averages can achieved based input parameters. example, let’s calculate grade range student completed 30 ECTS credits, current grade average 1.5, 90 ECTS credits remaining complete. assume best possible grade 1 worst possible grade 5 per German grading system.
code: completed <- 30 grade <- 1.5 remaining <- 90  calculate_grade_range(completed, grade, remaining,                       max_passing_grade = 1, min_passing_grade = 5) #>  best_outcome worst_outcome  #>         1.125         4.125

title: gradecast
text: plot_grade_range() function used create plot grade range. function takes following arguments: completed_ects: number ECTS credits already completed current_grade: current grade average remaining_ects: number ECTS credits remaining complete max_passing_grade: best possible grade min_passing_grade: worst possible grade show_caption: whether display text caption caption_width: text width caption function returns ggplot2 object visualizes grade range. shaded region represents range possible grade averages can achieved based input parameters. red line indicates worst possible scenario, .e., obtaining worst possible grade classes, green line indicates best possible scenario, .e., obtaining best possible grade classes. blue dashed line represents highest passing grade. Using scenario previous example, can use plot_grade_range() function visualize grade range.  Note: function actually wraps calculate_grade_range() function creates ggplot2 object based results (hence reason many arguments). ggplot2 object can customized using standard ggplot2 syntax.
code: plot_grade_range(completed, grade, remaining,                  max_passing_grade = 1, min_passing_grade = 5,                  caption_width = 100)

title: gradecast
text: caption_builder() function used build text caption grade range plot. caption can optionally turned ggplot2 object, useful text needed rendered well image file. Instead, Shiny app creates separate text box caption. function takes following arguments: min_passing_grade: worst possible grade max_passing_grade: best possible grade caption_width: text width caption show_caption: whether display text caption function returns character string contains text caption. example, let’s build caption grade range plot worst possible grade 5 best possible grade 1.
code:
caption_builder(min_passing_grade = 5, max_passing_grade = 1,                 caption_width = 150, show_caption = TRUE) #> [1] "The shaded region represents the range of all possible grade averages that can be achieved based on three factors: 1) the current grade average
or GPA, 2) the number of ECTS credits already completed, and 3) the amount of remaining ECTS. The red line indicates the worst possible scenario
i.e. obtaining 5s in all classes while the green line indicates the best possible scenario i.e. obtaining 1s in all classes. The blue dashed line
represents the highest passing grade."

title: gradecast
text: package also includes function convert_to_freedom_units() converts grades German scale (1-5) American scale (4-0). function takes grade German scale argument returns equivalent grade American scale. example, let’s convert grade 1.5 German scale American scale.
code: convert_to_freedom_units(1.5) #> [1] 3.5

title: gradecast
text: package also includes Shiny app allows users interactively explore grade range based input parameters. app organized built according opinionated {golem} package structure, provides robust scalable framework building Shiny applications. application can launched using following command: app consists several modules allow users input current grade, number ECTS credits already completed, number ECTS credits remaining complete, best worst possible grades program. app calculates visualizes grade range based inputs.
code: gradecast::run_app()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Pat Callahan. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: person, ) c=c (2024). gradecast: Calculate visualize potential school grades. R package version 0.1.0, https://neuroshepherd.github.io/gradecast/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {gradecast: Calculate and visualize potential school grades},   author = {{person} and comment = c )},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://neuroshepherd.github.io/gradecast/}, }

what: Calculate and visualize potential school grades
title: Calculate and visualize potential school grades
text: goal gradecast allow students calculate possible range final grades academic program based current grades, quantity completed ECTS points, number remaining ECTS points. package designed used Shiny app, user can input data see possible range final grades plot.

title: Calculate and visualize potential school grades
text: can install development version gradecast GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("NeuroShepherd/gradecast")

title: Calculate and visualize potential school grades
code: library(gradecast)  # Example of completing 1 semester i.e. 30 ECTS with a 1.5 grade (German) # and having 60 ECTS left to complete the program. Uses the standard German # grading scale of 1 to 5 (1 being the best grade and 5 being the worst). calculate_grade_range(   completed_ects = 30,   current_grade = 1.5,   remaining_ects = 60,   max_passing_grade = 1,   min_passing_grade = 5 ) #>  best_outcome worst_outcome  #>      1.166667      3.833333

title: Calculate and visualize potential school grades
code: # The results can be projected in a plot  plot_grade_range(   completed_ects = 30,   current_grade = 1.5,   remaining_ects = 60,   max_passing_grade = 1,   min_passing_grade = 5,   caption_width = 95 )

title: Calculate and visualize potential school grades
code: run_app()

title: Calculate and visualize potential school grades
text: package also provides function convert grades different grading scales, particular supports conversion German US grading scales (affectionaly known “freedom units” .)
code: grade_in_germany <- 1.3  convert_to_freedom_units(grade_in_germany) #> [1] 3.7

title: Calculate grade range — calculate_grade_range
text: function calculates best worst possible grade averages can achieved based current grade average, number ECTS credits already completed, number remaining ECTS credits complete.

title: Calculate grade range — calculate_grade_range
code: calculate_grade_range(   completed_ects,   current_grade,   remaining_ects,   max_passing_grade = 1,   min_passing_grade = 5 )

title: Calculate grade range — calculate_grade_range
text: completed_ects number ECTS credits already completed current_grade current grade average remaining_ects number ECTS credits remaining complete max_passing_grade best possible grade min_passing_grade worst possible grade

title: Calculate grade range — calculate_grade_range
text: vector best worst possible grade averages

title: Calculate grade range — calculate_grade_range
code: calculate_grade_range(120, 3.5, 60) #>  best_outcome worst_outcome  #>      2.666667      4.000000  calculate_grade_range(120, 3.5, 60, 1, 5) #>  best_outcome worst_outcome  #>      2.666667      4.000000

title: Caption builder — caption_builder
text: Builds text caption grade range plot. caption can optionally turned ggplot2 object useful text needed rendered well image file. Instead, Shiny app creates separate text box caption.

title: Caption builder — caption_builder
code: caption_builder(   min_passing_grade,   max_passing_grade,   caption_width = 150,   show_caption = TRUE )

title: Caption builder — caption_builder
text: min_passing_grade worst possible grade max_passing_grade best possible grade caption_width text width caption. default 150 show_caption whether display text caption

title: Caption builder — caption_builder
text: character string

title: Caption builder — caption_builder
code:
caption_builder(min_passing_grade = 5, max_passing_grade = 1) #> [1] "The shaded region represents the range of all possible grade averages that can be achieved based on three factors: 1) the current grade average
or GPA, 2) the number of ECTS credits already completed, and 3) the amount of remaining ECTS. The red line indicates the worst possible scenario
i.e. obtaining 5s in all classes while the green line indicates the best possible scenario i.e. obtaining 1s in all classes. The blue dashed line
represents the highest passing grade."

what: Convert grades to freedom units — convert_to_freedom_units
title: Convert grades to freedom units — convert_to_freedom_units
text: function takes vector grade German scale converts "freedom units" scale .e. equivalent American GPA scale. calculation makes use -called "Bavarian formula."

title: Convert grades to freedom units — convert_to_freedom_units
code: convert_to_freedom_units(grades, max_passing_grade = 4, min_passing_grade = 1)

title: Convert grades to freedom units — convert_to_freedom_units
text: grades vector grades German scale max_passing_grade maximum passing grade score US. 4 always min_passing_grade minimum passing grade score US. 1 always

title: Convert grades to freedom units — convert_to_freedom_units
text: vector grades "freedom units"

title: Convert grades to freedom units — convert_to_freedom_units
code: convert_to_freedom_units(grades = c(1.3, 2.8)) #> [1] 3.7 2.2

what: gradecast: Calculate and visualize potential school grades — gradecast-package
title: gradecast: Calculate and visualize potential school grades — gradecast-package
text: Convert German US grades/GPA systems. Visualize potential final GPA based current grades remaining European Credit Transfer Accumulation points (ECTS).

title: Plot grade range — plot_grade_range
text: Plot grade range

title: Plot grade range — plot_grade_range
code: plot_grade_range(   completed_ects,   current_grade,   remaining_ects,   max_passing_grade = 1,   min_passing_grade = 5,   show_caption = T,   caption_width = 150 )

title: Plot grade range — plot_grade_range
text: completed_ects number ECTS credits already completed current_grade current grade average remaining_ects number ECTS credits remaining complete max_passing_grade best possible grade min_passing_grade worst possible grade show_caption whether display text caption caption_width text width caption. default 150

title: Plot grade range — plot_grade_range
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot grade range — plot_grade_range
code: # On the German scale plot_grade_range(30, 1.5, 90)    # Now the same plot, but on the American scale and converting the grades. # Note the `.` in the `plot_grade_range` function call. This is a placeholder # for the result of the previous function call.  convert_to_freedom_units(1.5) %>%   plot_grade_range(30, ., 90, max_passing_grade = 4, min_passing_grade = 1)

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: Run Shiny Application

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See `?golem::get_golem_options` details.
